website_summaries.verdict: Ideal window film for completely blacking out windows. Great for night shift workers and nurseries.
pros: Easy to install, non-adhesive application uses static to cling to the surface
Blackout version is great at eliminating light completely
cons: Some users find the film won't stay up in colder climates

customer_reviews.title: So far so good We will see what happens when it’s 105° outside ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good We will see what happens when it’s 105° outside I did the installation by myself ( and I am a senior female) The product is thicker than I thought it would be and that makes me happy , And I would recommend a brand new box cutter blade and a very very sharp set of scissors The directions were very clear I think the key is really really working the film to get the air bubbles out And these are really big windows 31 x 50” It really blacks the room out well so I am cautiously optimistic at this point 😃
customer_reviews.author: charles k kastler

customer_reviews.title: Blocks light well but gets super hot
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and blocks light completely. The one problem is that this stuff gets incredibly hot when it’s in direct sunlight, as it’s black it is absorbing every little bit of sunlight that’s touching it and turning it into heat. I live in the southwest (Albuquerque) and this stuff seems ok for the fall and winter but I’m a little worried how hot it’s going to get in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Tzufeng

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to change my review from 4 to 1 star. I came to my bedroom on a sunny day and it smelled like burning plastic took me few minutes to figure out what was the smell. Be careful if you are using it to block the sun from entering your room
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey and Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Primo solution for those working night shift!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works well. My girlfriend is a nurse who works night shift. I put this on the bedroom window and it completely changed her life. It's full on Vegas blackout. Maybe 1% of light might leak through in super bright direct sunlight between the edges of the window but that's really quibbling. If you cut it a quarter inch oversized you'd kill even that little bit of light leakage. It's literally cave spelunking dark. Huge quality of life improvement for anyone that works the night shift.
customer_reviews.author: Raven99

customer_reviews.title: Blocks light but also breaks windows
customer_reviews.text: This product actually did deliver–it completely blocked out the light–and was relatively easy to install. However, after removing the film gently, I noticed that the film had cracked the windows. The heat and sunlight being applied to the thin window was fine when it allowed that heat to enter the house, but when you trap them with this material IT CAN CRACK YOUR WINDOWS. It is unfortunate as the product did work, just a little too well...

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for parents of young kids
customer_reviews.text: Works great, not total blackout but I'd say about 90%. Bought it because my 4 year old wouldn't go to bed because she could see light from the window and she argued it was still daytime. Problem solved with this! Installation was a breeze. Would definitely recommend for parents with young kids. I have to admit it has only been up for a couple of days so I don't know yet if it will stay on. However, I also have to add that it keeps the bedroom cooler which is a plus for us.
customer_reviews.author: cat fan

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, looks better than I thought! Blackout Window version
customer_reviews.text: This is some amazing stuff, finally got rid of the glare on my TV caused by my front door. I was honestly thinking about buying a whole new door then someone recommended putting something like this over the window. I thought the black might look really bad but it actually blends pretty nice. Application is pretty easy, only hard part was cutting around the curved piece, I think I just needed a sharper blade and I could do it better. Took me about 5 minutes after I got the package open.
customer_reviews.author: Mibix

customer_reviews.title: This static window film is impressive, totally room darkening as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I've been working the overnight shift for more than nineteen years now. However, sleeping during midday can still be most challenging for me at times. Therefore, I have sought out a way of mitigating the suns effect on my sleeping. This is what brought me to purchase the room darkening window film. I must say that I'm most impressed that the film works as advertised. I haven't slept, so good in ages for midday is now comparable to sleeping at night since the install. I'm pleased that I made this purchase. A big thumbs up too the seller for supplying a high-quality product promptly. Warm regards, Antown
customer_reviews.author: Antown

customer_reviews.title: Dark and not too difficult
customer_reviews.text: This material was easy to work with, and it’s completely opaque, which is what I required. I have three windows, each roughly 15x30 inches. One roll covers one window. I paid $16 for a single roll. So basically I get opaque windows for about $50. The instructions “require” a squeegee, sold separately. I’m not sure it’s necessary. I did buy one, and I’m certain I could go real cheap on the squeegee or just use a ruler. While there is enough leftover film to do some patch work, it’s not enough leftover to cover even a small pane of glass. While this will be great in winter; it’s not ideal for summer - I open the windows at night, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Juliette

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: This window film was easy to install and works well. I have a few medical conditions that are affected by light and this blackout window film helps. After reinstalling my blackout curtains, there was NO light coming through (even where I missed a few spots). The window looks dark from the outside of the house, but does not look bad or strange at all. If you're looking for something that is temporary for the window and works, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Application is a little involved, but product does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am happy with the product. It blocks out sunlight very well. There were two things I found a little irritating. The finished side is textured and sparkly. I would have preferred a smooth, flat finish. Application was a little more laborious than anticipated. You have to make your own solution to spray on the window and the product before you put it in place. But the product is cut and trimmed with scissors and a utility/ x-actor knife easily. It works as advertised and I would definitely recommend it to someone looking for this type of product.
customer_reviews.author: Burleigh Clarke

customer_reviews.title: This thing so far is great, lets in no light and my room looks ...
customer_reviews.text: I work overnights and have always had issue with the darkening shades and curtains always letting in a little light. This thing so far is great, lets in no light and my room looks like the middle of the night all the time. Very easy to install, not sure about removing but it looks like it will be easy to remove. At this time I would highly recommend this product to day sleepers.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: So here’s the issue. This film heats your window up substantially. We have a big half moon window upstairs and that’s what we bought this for as we were using the room as a nursery and wanted to block light. That room faces the setting sun and gets hot. But putting that film on heated our window up so bad that it made the glue fail that held the two panels together. Now out window is leaking. I’m not 100% on this but the window was fine before it and it’s not even a window that can open or close and get damaged that way. Just buyer beware if you’re using it for a room that gets hot!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Effective window film and amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I work overnight shifts and purchased this after buying several ineffective "blackout curtains". It came in a roll with the instructions on the back. All I used was a measuring tape to measure my window, a pair of sharp scissors, and a credit card. I applied it in less than 5 minutes and I'm actually amazed at how much light it blocks out! Unfortunately, I didn't order the right size but I contacted customer service and they resolved my issue the same day! I definitely would recommend this to anyone working night shifts. With a thin fleece throw over my window, I literally can't see ANY light in my room midday.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Really blocks light
customer_reviews.text: Put this on my bedroom windows. Blocks out light but it's super tough to get the edges perfect. Even cut perfect a small ring of light shines around. One window I was able to over cut an 1/8" and tuck it into the frame. The other window I couldn't do that on. I cut black tape and overlapped the edge. Behind the blind and curtains you cant tell. Setting sun shines right on my bedroom window and would light the room up so bright I couldn't stand it when trying to catch an afternoon map for midnight shift.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron travis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, remove, and reuse.
customer_reviews.text: I love this blackout film. It is super easy to apply! Just make sure not to cut it too small. It does stretch a bit on the first application, so I would recommend waiting to do the final trim for a few minutes. Other than that, it is the easiest film I have ever used. My favorite feature is that if I need to look out of one of the windows I have it on I can just lift up the corner. Then when I put it back down it sticks back by just running my hand over it.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Kat

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This film works exactly as described. It was easy to install, sticks to the glass very well, and totally blocks out the light. Some advise is not to install it when there is direct sunlight on the window as the film got too warm when I was installing it and it stretched out of shape a little. However when it cooled it fit great and sticks well.
customer_reviews.author: Over65Buyer

customer_reviews.title: With patience and a sharp Xacto knife, this is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: So like any other window film, this takes careful measuring, patience, a lot of mildly soapy water, a squeegee, and a very sharp cutting knife but once installed it's fantastic. It blocks out 100% of the light and I used it in a nursery that was getting sun 80% of the day and on the small port rear door windows that normal car window covers don't reach. It hasn't peeled at all in the past few weeks I've had it installed. It's not a lot of material however so make sure you measure your needs and order an adequate amount. I would absolutely recommend this over one-way mirror film if visibility isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to use - and I'm NOT very handy. The product is thick, so it doesn't curl up like Con-tact paper. I was apprehensive, but it went quickly and came out nice. I just did the bottom of a very big window but can tell there is much less light coming through. Will probably order more and finish the window. So much easier and affordable than the alternative - room-darkening shades or curtains.
customer_reviews.author: Miamigrrl

customer_reviews.title: this did wonders for privacy and sleep in my room
customer_reviews.text: One day in and although I cut it a little too short, it worked so well to block light and lay cleanly on the glass door to my bedroom. No more waking up from the hallway light. Super easy to install, just be careful with the "razor at the window's edge" cutting, because following that instruction made it so that I have light peeking through at the edges on all sides. Would definitely buy again / buy in the future - hopefully it sticks in place for a while.
customer_reviews.author: xcellent

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother with the instructions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions call for more effort than is needed considering you can just clean the window, make sure it’s wet and stick it up. You do need to cut along the frame with a good sharp knife as anything less will cause it to look jagged.
customer_reviews.author: RighteousJB

customer_reviews.title: Measure twice, cut once
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light black out product. Very simple to use (just follow the easy application steps) As long as you follow the steps its super easy to apply. Blocks out all light. Make sure you measure exactly (using a xacto knife is your best bet for straight, exact cut) If you leave any area open to light, you'll have a strong beam of light across that area. Other than its not much for decor (although it has a nice black sparkly look), it does its job well. Customer service was also great if you have any issues! Not sure if they are reusable ... Be great to have more decorative options with a black out film
customer_reviews.author: Moses Park

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Stay On
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product based on the positive reviews that I read, however, for me, the bottom line is that it just doesn't stay up. I installed this on my two bedroom windows that the suns comes shinning through early in the morning. The first couple of days, it was okay (but not great), but after 8 days now, it's starting to peel off. I'll be taking advantage of the "SATISFACTION GUARANTEE – Contact us anytime via Amazon for a free refund, no return necessary! ", as this seems to have been a waste of time and money. Lastly, this stuff isn't as easy to work with as many reviews make it out to be.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product to help prevent light from coming in from the bottom of the curtains in our master. The product didn't work for it's intended purpose but the customer service was amazing. I'm always skeptical to order anything that says 100% satisfaction guaranteed because it always seems to be a lot of hoops to jump through to get a refund. This was not the case with this product. I simply sent an email (towards the end of the business day) and I got a response right away asking for my amazon order number and the refund was proceeded in an hour. I would definitely recommend buying this film because if it doesn't work you have nothing to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Nimit

customer_reviews.title: Look at the Item size/scale. Great product and I expected a 4/5 star item and got 5/5
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect and easy to use item, there is no opacity as it says and the sheet clings well even without the suggested use of water dish soap mix. Make sure you look at the size you are buying, I didn't look and ordered the smallest size sheet and ended up ordering the larger size, the smaller size is only good if you are covering small windows but I guess that should be intuitive. This item is perfect for home, I haven't used this product in situations that could be demanding of it such as places that rub or put pressure/force on the Tint sheet itself but its perfect for general home use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, i thought I might have to use clear packing along the edges because it was purchased for a glass block window, rather than a smooth, flat pane. I didn't expect it to hold perfectly since it would be applied over wavy window squares and mortar, but it went up easily and stayed put perfectly. The instructions are clear and simple, and as an added bonus, are printed directly on the back off the pull-off paper (which is also gridded for easy, straight cutting). Can't get any better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Word Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer :(.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I receive a clear piece of junk, when I ordered and paid for dark film? I’m very unhappy with this purchase and the big inconvenience it’s caused. I start night shift in two days. Sometimes I wish that people would be more honest in these reviews. I would like a full refund please.
customer_reviews.author: Nissa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great for a quick solution to light
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job at keeping a room dark. The adhesion isn't outstanding but is good enough to get the job done. Works better if you do a better job prepping and keeping it neat - try to cover the window as well as possible without overlapping the edges to prevent light from poking through and letting it cling to the window better. Make sure to clean off your window beforehand to help it cling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: im a shift worker and these are necessary. ABSOLUTELY ...
customer_reviews.text: im a shift worker and these are necessary. ABSOLUTELY OPAQUE. follow the directions to prevent slippage. but, tbh.. i used tape to secure mine at the top. i have curtains still over the window and no one can see the tape so who cares - i can sleep during the day without any light in my room, thats what i wanted. this beats any room darkening or blackout curtains i've purchased. that little sliver of light peeking through is a think of the past.
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Research and buy additional prep tools needed
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend getting the items typically purchased with (razor, firm film squeegee and window scrapper) be sure to clean window and cracks well and then use a razor to make smooth cuts. I YouTubed videos before installing. The instructions came through a follow up email that would not open. I still got the film installed and it looks great! 100% block out is accurate (excluding the extremely thin line next to the window edges.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total Blackout!
customer_reviews.text: Totally blacks out the room if cut correctly and with a sharp tool. A dull tool leaves a rough edge and allows light to creep in. We had to use black Gorilla tape to block out the light and keep the film in place. Clean your window well to avoid having to tape the cling to the window. Our mistake.
customer_reviews.author: NM Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Installing the window film was much easier than I expected. I have had some frustrating experiences with sticky Contact paper, and I was worried the window film would be similar. However, it was NOT the same at all. The window film could be moved easily and adjusted so it was just right before you squeegee it into place. Directions are easy to follow, and the grid on the paper backing aides in cutting pieces to fit. After installation, the rooms are definitely dark.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Porter

customer_reviews.title: Blocks out sun
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this film. It was easy to cut thanks to the grid on the backing.I wet the window and smoothed it down with a credit card. It was a small window so it took me no time to finish.It is a powder room window that over looks the driveway. When I turned on the room lights no light was visible from the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructions and application
customer_reviews.text: It totally does what it says, Easy to follow instructions and application. It blackens out the window providing total darkness.
customer_reviews.author: MadMaddy

customer_reviews.title: Baby takes long naps now!
customer_reviews.text: Night and day difference (ha, no pun intended) for daytime baby naps. By accident we discovered that our baby needed a pitch black room to sleep during the day and this was the solution. A little dodgy to put up if you’re trying to make the edges perfectly nice, and it does shift slightly over time after application, but I would do it again if it meant 2-3x’s as long for naps. Lifesaver stuff.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Complete Blackout, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product was very easy to install. It is complete black out which is exactly what I was looking for since I work night shift. Would recommend if you are looking for complete black out! As for durability, I have only had it on for a few days and so I can’t speak for it as much. It does seem to peel off easily as they mention so I added a small border of black tape to it which helped cover the imperfections in cutting it down to size where it allowed light to come through. Definitely would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: DenaJG

customer_reviews.title: A good workaround would be to cover it completely with those ...
customer_reviews.text: In terms of darkening the room, this works 100% However, it does have a strong rubbery smell that doesn't really go away even after airing it for a week. It also seem to be peeling a little at the edges, but that is probably because the windows get exposed to the sun several hours a day. A good workaround would be to cover it completely with those large/wide shipping tapes, after the film is applied properly. This will prevent the peeling on the edges over time, and it'll help minimize the rubbery smell
customer_reviews.author: Doodly

customer_reviews.title: It will stick to the window just long enough for you to leave the room.
customer_reviews.text: This product did exactly two things correctly. 1. It has a convenient grid on the back for easy cutting, and 2. It actually blocks out light. Beyond that, it's an absolute nightmare. I had to use about 30 feet of duct tape to hold it in place. I literally could have used tin foil and it would have been more convenient and easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Definitely blacks out windows
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a few helicopter windows. Working with curves on both axis makes it more challenging to install. Couldn't remove all air bubbles, but I can't see them, it doesn't effect blocking, and sheet hasn't loosened because of that. With sun Beating down overhead on this installed above, some heat still radiates, but the haven't loosened. Only recommendation would be to make window side white to reflect light and reduce heat transmission. I'd recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Desertpilot

customer_reviews.title: Wish roll was longer
customer_reviews.text: This blackout film works very well and is much easier to install than other types of window films (privacy frosted, decorative)I have used in the past becaery use it is thicker and less likely to flip back on itself as you try to lift it into place. My only complaint is that I have very large windows and I would need to buy at least 3 more rolls to cover them all.
customer_reviews.author: alm711

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: So I had to purchase TWO of these to cover one small window in my bedroom. I work night shift and need complete darkness when sleeping during the day. my husband installed it with no problem. I didn't let any light in and i thought it was worth the money. When I woke up today, it had completely fallen off the window and was crumpled on the floor. When I went to put it back on, it had shrunk so much... it was about 3/4 it's original size. Luckily, amazon has wonderful customer service and was able to refund me.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kristine Straley

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the window film to block the sun out of my baby’s room so she could nap more peacefully during the day. This product works PERFECT; I am so pleased. And baby is sleeping well!
customer_reviews.author: T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: This worked better than I could have imagined
customer_reviews.text: This worked better than I could have imagined! Way cheaper than having to buy blinds or shades. It really is 100% blackout and comes off the window really easily without leaving marks. Since I put it up a corner or two has curled up a little bit but I just tacked the edge up with a little black tape and the rest stays on just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Pointless to purchase as product does not adhere for long
customer_reviews.text: Bought two packs to transform bedroom into a dungeon due to unconventional sleeping schedule. Product was difficult to install but I was eventually pleased once I got two windows covered. Had intentions to buy more to cover more windows but 1 hour after installing areas were already starting to fall off window. Disappointed with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jody L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product
customer_reviews.text: This works great to block out all of the light. It has helped keep this room much cooler this summer and allowed it to be dark when it’s bed time even though the sun is still up. My only complaint is that in spots it has started to peak away, but my guess is that it install error.
customer_reviews.author: dickson

customer_reviews.title: ; I am a very light sleeper and this works for me & love it!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for your Window Film; I am a very light sleeper and this works for me & love it! I would recommend this for anyone wanting light from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Priebe

customer_reviews.title: Measure twice and cut once.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been on night shift for our entire marriage. Despite Bali light blocking insulation blinds we still had light leakage our window. After buying and apply this the bedroom is a pit of darkness. So husband is very pleased. Easy to use and install. It’s been up several weeks now and is working well.
customer_reviews.author: Karwyn

customer_reviews.title: it helped me get some sleep
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble sleeping and needed to block light from my bedroom window. This really did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Bobandee

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to apply. Tried 5 different times and it just fell off the next day. Very disappointing. Was not able to return since it was past the return date but i really wanted it to work so i kept trying to apply it.
customer_reviews.author: Tinahn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: The French doors in my bedroom have curtains but the morning sun shines straight into my room. I placed the window whirl paper on the windows under the curtains and it has made all the difference. Very quick and easy to install. I’m now sleeping until my alarm wakes me instead of the sun!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as perhaps one might think....
customer_reviews.text: This was my fault, but I didn't measure my window and expected that one roll would be sufficient to cover a normal sized bedroom window...this was in fact not true. The portion of the window I covered is quite dark...the other portion, not so much. As it is not that large of a portion, it makes it a pricier product than I had originally thought.
customer_reviews.author: Kselund

customer_reviews.title: Total blackout window film
customer_reviews.text: Keeps room dark, so that 105d wheather want give you a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: It sticks on very good at first put when the sun hits it and the window gets hot the film shrinks at the four corners and bubbles up. When I got home the film had fallen off to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Normajean

customer_reviews.title: Night shift travel nurse need this!
customer_reviews.text: I would have never guessed this would be so easy to apply and remove. And it’s reusable! The trick is not to cut it to exact size, but allow it to overlap the window. If cut to exact size of the glass, and you accidentally cut it short by the smallest sliver, light will come through.
customer_reviews.author: P. Reaves

customer_reviews.title: If you need TOTAL darkness
customer_reviews.text: It was really interesting to put up. But it totally blacks out light. It's great and didn't take more then an hour to get the windows done
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh Parks

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY! Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These are awful. Even with all the “before you start” instructions- I followed them and read the reviews. Believe the ones where it’s hot. I put these up- not an even placement on apartment windows-if you cut slightly off you can’t trim and they fell off over night! 95 degree weather. Total waste of money. Should have gotten curtains. Can’t even return them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia W.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. It goes on so easily and looks amazing. It has a little sparkly appearance which adds depth.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Effective and easy product...!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, easy product to work with. It gives good blackout for my sleeping requirements!
customer_reviews.author: Gisel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what you hope it would. It's completely opaque. It is not difficult to install though my only recommendation is to make sure you have a sharp X-acto knife - I had a not-so-great ceramic one and have some chatter on the sides that is letting in just a sliver of light. But that was my own doing.
customer_reviews.author: dina

customer_reviews.title: I tried , but it failed.
customer_reviews.text: The film is thick and truly blocks out light. Despite following the instructions closely, the film was hard to install. It has no adhesive what so ever, so you’ll need a few more materials . It’s definitely a two person job if applying in larger panels. Fell from window within a few days. It could have been my installation work or the quality of the product . Either way I wasn’t impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: The material is literally a big sheet of vinyl decal. Very fussy to use, and despite thoroughly Windex-in the window before installation, the product fell off the window within the span of the first day. Im a night shift nurse, and i was really looking looking forward to a nice dark room after i got off, but no such luck. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Blackout!
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it’s description says. It blocks out sunlight so my preschooler stays in bed a little longer in the mornings.
customer_reviews.author: BRITTANY S.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Working nights and needed darkness to sleep more soundly. This film was easy to install and works great. It will be simple to remove if ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Lovey

customer_reviews.title: This is truly blackout window film.
customer_reviews.text: This is truly blackout window film. I love it. When you apply the window film cut off as much extra film so it stays in place better. An extra 2 inches is about right. Then you can apply it and do a final trim with a razor blade. For the area where my razor blade slipped, I just used a piece of black tape to fix my error.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: This worked far better than my expectations. I expected a really dark film, but this is actually opaque! Helps with the blazing sun in the summer for room cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Easy to install and works perfectly to darken our bedroom. As nightshift nurses it’s something I recommend to any nurse struggling to sleep during the day. Actually, it even outperformed a similar product from Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I work nights and this works great to block out the light so I can sleep. Only issue I've had is when the temperature first dipped some condensation caused a corner to peel off the window. Though once it dried I was able to press it back on and it has been sticking with no issues since.
customer_reviews.author: nik

customer_reviews.title: Better than a curtain
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Measure, cut, spray, and put into place and your done. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cat

customer_reviews.title: No more neighbors!
customer_reviews.text: put this on my back windows and now i dont see my neighbors bright light blaring into my window while i try and sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the back of an aquarium, but I can see it would work well for windows as well. Super easy to install. Outside surface is matte and somewhat textured, so it seems it would absorb sunlight well.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Total blackness!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I disliked about this film! It way better than I expected! I expected it to have a sticky back but it dosen't! Once you peel the back off, you place it on the glass and it clings to the glass! The paper backing has a one inch grid which is great for trimming! This film is so worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! Easy to put up by myself and made a huge difference. I used the blackout film to darken my son's room. I just wish that is bought the bigger size because I underestimated the area to cover by a few inches. It's so good at blocking light though, I'm just leaving the small area uncovered so we get a little natural daylight in the evenings.
customer_reviews.author: Sara McLin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Not perfect. Easy install
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it'll show in the picture, but it wasn't 100% light blocking with the sun directly on it. Maybe around 95%. Still pretty good. It was easy to install, and seems to be a good quality. Not sure it'll work for me, as it has a sparkly, glittery look to it. Since I'm using this in a home theater room, it's possible it'll cause issues with light from the projector reflecting. I'll report back after I've tried it out.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Smith

customer_reviews.title: Blocks All Light
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely 100% opaque! Follow the instructions though, the film does shrink after application. Be sure to leave a little extra around the edges (as instructed) so you don't have any gaps after it dries.
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nicely blocks sunlight
customer_reviews.text: This window film is very well made and easy to use. I like that the side facing inside the room has a subtle texture. Unfortunately for me I'm not very good with cutting a straight line so my edges are a bit ragged. To combat this I'd recommended using a razor blade to give your film a cleaner edge. Once on the window it does block light from entering the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Works really well at keeping the light out. Went on really easy & is staying in place. Will use again when needed to keep the light out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Really strong.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been struggling with insomnia for years and have tried different black out curtains but nothing was as strong as these. They are super easy to install, black out the light almost completely, and they have a nice surface. They arrived on the promised delivery date. I highly recommend these. They may be what finally helps you start sleeping well.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Pearlman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, Bigtime!
customer_reviews.text: It did the job!! wonderful product .easy to apply, blacks out perfectly.Amazon you did it again!I can depend on fast service and a quality product Thanks , again Selma Rowell
customer_reviews.author: selma rowell

customer_reviews.title: Love this - will get more
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT It's perfect for our grandson's room Makes the room dark so he can sleep, but we're still able to open windows and let light in Plus I love know I can just "peel away" if I want to change the lighting and can reapply later again. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I typically do not leave reviews but this is a great product. Purchased for my infants room that has a window that receives direct sunlight the majority of the day. His room is now noticeably cooler and the product was super easy to install and actually looks really nice from the inside and outside. Will be purchasing this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin S Crum

customer_reviews.title: Be careful and precise
customer_reviews.text: I love this blackout paper and it has worked beautifully in my home. However, you have to be precise and I would suggest being very generous with amount of paper going over your edges of the window (you can always just use an exacto knife on the edges once the paper is placed). Anyway, I have no complaints and I am happy with how my windows turned out. I would definitely recommend this if you need more of a blackout than curtains can provide.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Super Black
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install and you can’t see anything...I used to to cover a bathroom window and it did the job. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install. I thought it would be at least as challenging as contact paper, but it is far more easier. It really blocks out light very well. Now my partner and I can sleep better. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Ismarí

customer_reviews.title: Good as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, instructions were perfect. Darkening is really effective. Really like this product a lot. Excellent value. I had to use two pieces on one of the for windows and it worked very well spliced together.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Petrilli

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I work nights & suffer from insomnia. These along with room darkening curtains really make a huge difference in helping me sleep during the day. Easy to install. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for third shifters!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product for anyone who works third shift and needs to sleep during the day. I have never installed any sort of tint or window clings before and this wasn’t too terrible. My measurements were a little off so there was a sliver of light here or there that I covered with electrical tape. Because I also have black out curtains, I wasn’t concerned with how they looked, I was only concerned about functionality. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: James M Bartley

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good product and does its job well
customer_reviews.text: This film really does “black out!” I will be honest-I did not follow the application directions but I peeled it off and it’s on my windows nonetheless. I was looking for a film that would lesson the brightness for my kids during nap time. I was looking for something a bit more transparent-This product will definitely darken your room. You can not see through it. It’s not exactly what I wanted but that’s my fault! Seems to be a good product and does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job of blacking out light
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. We have windows in the basement that needed to be covered and this did the job nicely! I really liked the instructions on the back. That made it easy to apply them. They do a great job of blocking light (The only reason a little light is coming in on my picture is because I did a bad job cutting it straight.)
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Northcott

customer_reviews.title: Day sleepers will love this
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great! Quick and easy installation. As close to near complete darkness in the middle of the day I thought possible...
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Ro

customer_reviews.title: no light shows through
customer_reviews.text: I can sleep better now that the light does not come into the room.
customer_reviews.author: Ted B.

customer_reviews.title: Total Blackout
customer_reviews.text: Completely backs out windows which is exactly what I wanted. I might buy some black silicone caulk to seal edges. A very small bit of light comes around edges no matter how well you trim. But I have blinds and curtains over wimdows so it’s probably OCD to take that extra step. The product works really well and is s breeze to install if you get an optional window adhesive spatula cutter thing.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Very dark but edges are hard to do.
customer_reviews.text: It goes on easy but trimming it isn’t easy. I used a sharp razor and followed the frame tightly but some light still gets through. I tried to use electrical tape to block the fine line but the tape won’t stick to the material.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: talk about black out!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install... totally dummy proof... AND it does its job with blacking out sunlight! We even put this on our window in the shower, but even with all the water that gets on it, it's in tact and doesn't look like it's coming off anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this film!!
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions carefully!! It will make the installation a piece of cake!! My room is literally pitch black! I used the extra material and lined the edges of the windows and used scotched tape to tape it on top of the film sort of overlapping it for better coverage!!! It’s literally night 24 hours of the day in my room. When I want sunlight and fresh air, ill open the window and its just the right amount of light!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Uribe

customer_reviews.title: Get the right size
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I should have got a larger size. Had todo a lot of custom cutting to make it work. Even with some bad work it blocks 95% of the light.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to install and blacks out perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to black out a window that lets in a lot of morning light too early. It works perfectly. No light is getting through at all. Much better than the black out curtains! It was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni Saulino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Life saver while travelingtorelatives places! My baby was able to have nice long naps!
customer_reviews.author: K. Ha

customer_reviews.title: Night shifters need this 🙌🏻🙌🏻
customer_reviews.text: This is something need if you work night shift! It’s easy-ish to install when you have another person to help you! It would have been harder if I was alone. You have to get a precise measurement to ensure no light coming in. I wasn’t good at precisely measuring it so I had a tiny bit of night coming it, but I had a curtain I put up that blocked it. It definitely makes a difference. I haven’t taken it off, so hopefully it’s easy and won’t mess the window up. I have been recommending this to family members and friends that work nights. I honestly don’t know how I slept in my room without it!
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it. So easy to install. Also great customer service. They made sure I didn’t have any questions or concerns. Highly recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I don't have A/c in my apartment and the sun beats on the window in my room half the day. Put a few strips of this onto the window with some heavy curtains and problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bolan

product_meta.title: Total Blackout Window Film: 100% Light Blocking, Room Darkening Static Cling - No Residue Film for Privacy, Home Security, and Day Sleep - Easy Removal UV Prevention Treatment (17.5 x 80 inches)
feature_bullets: SATISFACTION GUARANTEE – Contact us anytime via Amazon for a free refund, no return necessary!
100% LIGHT BLOCKING to make your room as dark as night in the light of day – darker than curtains!
GREAT FOR DAY SLEEPING OR BABY NURSERY - sleep perfectly sound no matter the time of day
SUPER STATIC CLING allows easy application or removal from any smooth surface with no trace residue
EASY INSTRUCTIONS featured on release paper to ensure successful application
